newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: SOCCER SHOWCASE-PSV EMERGE FROM STALEMATE AS WINNERS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER SHOWCASE-PSV EMERGE FROM STALEMATE AS WINNERS.

text.p: The Dutch league title chase entered its final furlong with PSV Eindhoven still favourites after their 0-0 draw with Feyenoord at Rotterdam on Sunday.

But while PSV will be satisfied to have left Rotterdam with their three-point lead at the top of the table intact, the Dutch media were unanimous in their condemnation of the relatively dull spectacle between this season's top two sides.
"It was as if there was no title on offer, so unbearably dull was the match," the Algemeen Dagblad newspaper said.
Top-selling paper De Telegraaf asked who was to blame for the "dull tactical chess game" which drew only two saves of any note.
Feyenoord coach Arie Haan denied the game was as turgid as suggested, saying: "I saw an exciting match and, to go by the reaction of the crowd, they did too."
Haan was upbeat about his side's prospects despite being held at home to an understrength PSV.
With third-placed Twente Enschede losing at lowly FC Groningen on Sunday the title fight now looks to be a two-horse race that will break Ajax Amsterdam's three year dominance.

"We made things difficult for PSV who are a good side," Haan said. "With ten matches left, we are only three points behind. Who will make the first mistake? The fight for the championship has only just begun."
PSV coach Dick Advocaat was perhaps more honest about the entertainment value of Sunday's clash.
"At least it was nice weather," he said.
